subject: Art & Design
title: The F-Pattern: How People Scan Web Pages
description: A short lesson to help you apply The F-Pattern: How People Scan Web Pages.

hook.text: Eye-tracking studies show people read web pages in an F shape. Top line, scan down-left, second line, then scroll.

buildup.text: The F-pattern was discovered by Jakob Nielsen using heat maps of 232 users reading thousands of pages.

discovery.text: Users barely read. They scan headlines, first sentences, and bold text. The rest is skimmed or ignored entirely.

twist.text: Placing key content in the bottom-right is like hiding it. Almost nobody's eyes reach there naturally.

climax.text: Effective web design puts the most critical information top-left and uses headings to catch scanning eyes.

punchline.text: Don't design for readers. Design for scanners.
